member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Wizard.Wizard.IsWindowDialogResultUpdatingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the parent 's will be set when either the Cancel or Finish buttons are pressed.
member.value: true if the parent 's will be set when either the Cancel or Finish buttons are pressed; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
This property is only used when the property is set to true.
If this property setting is true, the . property will be set to false immediately before the close if the Cancel button is pressed. Likewise, the . property will be set to true immediately before the close if the Finish button is pressed.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether page navigation using the and commands is enabled.
member.value: true if page navigation using the commands is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When enabled and if using an extended mouse with a forward/back button configuration, pressing the mouse's forward button will execute the same action as clicking the wizard's Next button and pressing the mouse's back button will execute the same action as clicking the wizard's Back button.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Wizard.Wizard.WindowTitleBehavior

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Wizard.Wizard.WindowTitleCustomPageText
member.summary: Gets or sets the title text for the selected page to use when a of Custom is set.
member.value: The title text for the selected page to use when a of Custom is set. The default value is - Step {0} of {1}.
member.remarks:
This property is only used when is set to custom. It is passed as the format string to a String.Format call.
Multiple format items are passed in as parameters to this String.Format call. Index 0 is the current page index incremented by 1 for display purposes. Index 1 is the total number of pages. Both of these items are only useful for wizard that have a single linear execution path. Index 2 is the page title. Index 3 is the page caption. Index 4 is the page description.

member.summary: Normal page sequencing, in which pages are visited in the order in which they appear in the pages collection.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Wizard.WizardPageSequenceType.Stack
member.summary:
Normal page sequencing occurs when the Next button is pressed. Each page visited is stored in an internal stack. Back button presses move backwards through the stack.
This feature requires each 's Name property to be set.
The . property is ignored when using stack sequencing.
